tool.name: Emails

param.name: layer
param.dialogReference: Point, line, or polygon feature layer that will trigger emails to be sent.
param.pythonReference: Point, line, or polygon feature layer that will trigger emails to be sent.

param.name: delete
param.displayname: Delete all existing email configurations for this layer
param.dialogReference: Delete all email configurations for this layer.
param.pythonReference: Delete all email configurations for this layer.

param.name: email_settings
param.expression: Email Template {SQL Query} {Recipient Email Address} {Email Subject} {Field to Update} {Sent Value};Email Template {SQL Query} {Recipient Email Address} {Email Subject} {Field to Update} {Sent Value}...
param.dialogReference:
Emails will be sent in the order listed. For each email setting, provide the following information:

Email Template: HMTL template that defines the structure and content of the email.

SQL Query: SQL Query that defines which features will trigger this email to be sent. At a minimum, it is recommended that this query exclude features that have the indicated Sent Values.

Recipient Email Address: Either a static address to which the email should be sent, or the name of a field that contains the email address.

Email Subject: The subject line of the email.

Field to Update: This field will be updated with the provided Sent Value once this email has been attempted to be sent.

Sent Value: The value used to indicate when an attempt has been made to deliver this email. This value will be calculated even is an error occurs when sending the email, such as an invalid email address.

param.name: smtp_server
param.dialogReference: URL of the SMTP server used for sending emails.
param.pythonReference: URL of the SMTP server used for sending emails.

param.dialogReference: The username required to authenticate to the SMTP server. This is not required if authenticating through a port.
param.pythonReference: The username required to authenticate to the SMTP server. This is not required if authenticating through a port.

param.name: smtp_password
param.dialogReference: The password required to authenticate to the SMTP server. This is not required if authenticating through a port.
param.pythonReference: The password required to authenticate to the SMTP server. This is not required if authenticating through a port.

param.name: from_address
param.dialogReference: The address from which the emails should be sent.
param.pythonReference: The address from which the emails should be sent.

param.name: reply_address
param.dialogReference: The address that should be used for any replies to the email message.
param.pythonReference: The address that should be used for any replies sto the email message.

param.name: substitutions
param.dialogReference: To add attributes from the feature prompting the email to the body or subject of the message, specify text strings that appear in the body or subject and the field or text that should replace them. For example, to add the ID of a feature from the REQUESTID field to the email subject, include a piece of text such as {ID} in the configured Email Subject, and specify here that {ID} should be replaced with the value of the REQUESTID field. All specified substitutions are applied to both the email subject and the email body, for all emails configured for all layers.
